direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods retrieve values from the Option, but getValue(int) allows for specific index retrieval.
Both methods return a value, but getValue(String) allows for a default value if the value is null.
Both methods handle value retrieval, but getValues() returns an array of all values.
Both methods access the values list, but getValuesList() returns the list directly.
Both methods involve processing and storing values, but processValue(String) handles value parsing.

enhanced_by.reason: clearValues() should be called to reset the values before testing getValue() to ensure a clean state.
processValue(String) should be called to populate the values list before testing getValue().
getValues() can be used to verify the entire list of values after calling getValue().
